summary: The speaker discusses their unique approach to collecting books despite having already read them. They explain why they don't lend, sell, or simply borrow books from the library, nor rely solely on a Kindle for reading. Instead, they purchase physical copies of books even after reading them on a Kindle, just to display them on their bookshelf as a personal achievement or 'trophy.' The speaker emphasizes the aesthetic value of having a full bookshelf and the satisfaction derived from physically owning the books they've read.
keywords: books, reading, Kindle, bookshelf, collection, hobby, lending, selling, library, ownership, aesthetics
